title: Accessing the Question Bot - 3D Touch
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed on a 3D Touch supported device
custom_steps:
When a user long presses the At Bat icon,
taps on Ask At Bat
custom_expected: Then the user should be taken to the Ask At Bat feature

title: Accessing the Question Bot - More Menu
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user taps on More
and taps on Ask At Bat
custom_expected: Then the user should be taken to the Ask At Bat feature

title: Accessing the Question Bot - Mic Button
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When a user taps on the mic button found within the Team view, Scoreboard view, News view, Postseason view, or Stats view
custom_expected: Then the user should be taken to the Ask At Bat feature

title: Hiding the Question Bot
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When an Admin shows/hides the Ask At Bat button for specific sets of user

via config:
http://qa-atbatappconfig.mlb.com/ios/11.3.0/iphoneConfig.json

- "searchBotEnabled": true,
- "searchBotEnabled": false,
custom_expected:
Then the user specific set of users will see the Ask At Bat button
and other users will not see the Ask At Bat button

title: Question Bot - iPad
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed on an iPad
custom_steps: When the user accesses the Ask At Bat button
custom_expected: Then the Ask At Bat interface should appear within a full page modal window, operating similarly to the EPG.

title: Feature Launch Onboarding
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When a user accesses the Team Page

custom_steps_separated.content: and the user accesses the Team Page after a fresh install
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will not see the speech bubble

custom_steps_separated.content: and the user access the Team Page a second time after a fresh install
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will see a speech bubble pointing to the microphone icon explaining the new feature is available.

title: Initial Access Onboarding
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user taps on More Menu
and taps on Ask At Bat
custom_expected: Then the user is presented with an onboarding screen that explains the feature prior to asking my first question.

title: Initial Access Onboarding - Config
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When a user access the Team Page

custom_steps_separated.content: and an Admin has updated the text via a config
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user should see the updated text on the Ask At Bat onboarding screen

custom_steps_separated.content: and an Admin has reset everyone to "first-time user" status via a config value
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the should see the onboarding screen next time access the feature
but will not see the team view onboarding message

title: Microphone Access
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user accesses the Ask At Bat interface for the first time
and dismisses the onboarding message
custom_expected: Then the user is presented with a clear request to access the microphone

title: Speech Recognition Access
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user accesses the Ask At Bat interface for the first time
and dismisses the onboarding message

custom_steps_separated.content: and agrees to provide access to microphone
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is presented with a clear request to process speech recognition

custom_steps_separated.content: and declines to provide access to the microphone
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should not be asked to provide speech recognition access
and should instead proceed directly to the keyboard interface.

title: Question Interface
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When a user accesses the question interface

custom_steps_separated.content:
Use Case 1
and the user is a first time user of the feature
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user first go through onboarding and elects whether or not to provide microphone access and speech recognition access to the app.

custom_steps_separated.content:
Use Case 2
and the user has provided both microphone access and voice recognition access
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user should be initially taken to the microphone interface

custom_steps_separated.content:
Use Case 3
and the user has declined either permission
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user should be taken to the keyboard interface

custom_steps_separated.content:
Use Case 4
and the user is not a first time user of the feature
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the question interface will be the first screen displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
Use Case 5
and has granted permission or declined permission
and taps on the Keyboard button
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user is able to enter a text-based question using the on-screen keyboard

title: Question Interface - Microphone Access
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is in the Ask At Bat interface
and provided At Bat access to my microphone and has provided speech recognition access

custom_steps_separated.content: and the user taps on the microphone and begins speaking
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the microphone icon must move to reflect that I am actively dictating

custom_steps_separated.content: and when the user is speaking
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the question I am dictating should appear on the screen as text

custom_steps_separated.content: and when the user is finished speaking
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the microphone icon must stop moving to reflect that I have finished speaking
and this should occur three seconds after I have completed speaking

custom_steps_separated.content: and when the user is finished speaking
custom_steps_separated.expected: then a spinner should indicate the question is being processed

title: Question Interface - No Microphone Access
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When a user has not provided At Bat access to my microphone or speech recognition access

custom_steps_separated.content: and is on the Ask At Bat feature
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user must be taken directly to the text entry interface

custom_steps_separated.content: and the user taps on the microphone interface
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user should be shown an error message that explains the limitations of the feature without both permissions and a presents a link to enable permissions.

custom_steps_separated.content: and the user taps on the link to enable permissions on the error message from step 2
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user is taken into At Bat settings in the iOS Settings to enable microphone or speech recognition

custom_steps_separated.content: and the user taps on not now from the error message from step 2
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user should be returned to the text entry interface

title: Question Interface - Valid Question
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is on the Ask At Bat interface
and asks a valid Stats question
custom_expected: Then the user must be taken to a specific page within the Stats view that contains the answer to my question

title: Question Interface - Invalid Question
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is on the Ask At Bat interface
and asks a invalid non-stats related question
custom_expected:
Then the user must be shown a message indicating that the system cannot yet process my question as expected
and upon seeing this message, the must be able to begin providing my next question

title: Question Interface - Unable to Understand Question
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is on the Ask At Bat interface
and asks a question that is not able to be understood
custom_expected:
Then the user is shown a message asking me to try asking the question again in another way
and upon seeing this message, the user must be able to begin providing my next question

title: Return to Question Interface
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user who has asks a valid question and been taken to view the answer in the stats view
and taps on Done or X
custom_expected: then the user is returned to the question interface

title: iOS 9 or Below Users
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed on an pre iOS 10 device (iOS 9)
custom_steps: When a user is in At Bat an accesses the Ask At Bat feature

custom_steps_separated.content: and it is the first access the feature
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user is taken to the text entry interface immediately

(https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-19102 for expected behavior)

custom_steps_separated.content: and attempts to tap on the microphone icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user must be shown a message indicating that voice queries are only supported in iOS 10 or higher but that I am still able to ask questions using my keyboard

custom_steps_separated.content: and acknowledges that I understand
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user is taken back to the text entry interface

title: Offline State
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When a user attempts to access this Ask At Bat feature while in offline mode
custom_expected: Then the user must be shown a message indicating the feature is not available while in offline mode and returned to the previous screen

title: Deep Linking
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is in Safari and navigates to a deep link (mlbatbat://askatbat)
or taps on an article with a deep link (mlbatbat://askatbat)

custom_steps_separated.content: and the app is not running in the background
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user is taken to the Ask At Bat interface

custom_steps_separated.content: and the app is running in the background
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user is taken to the Ask At Bat interface

custom_steps_separated.content: and the app is backgrounded on Gameday
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user is taken to the Ask At Bat interface

custom_steps_separated.content: and app is backgrounded on a modal
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user is taken to the Ask At Bat interface

title: Team vs Individual Stats_SDBB-340
custom_preconds: GIVEN the bot needs to be able to discern better between team and individual when discussing teams

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is asking for the stat leaders on a given team

i.e. 
1. Who on the Yankees has the most home runs?
2. What Yankee has the most home runs?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is grouped by Individual
AND player image is displayed

i.e. 
1. Deeplink: mlbatbat://stats?stat_type=hitting&stat=hr&team_id=147
2. Deeplink: mlbatbat://stats?stat_type=hitting&stat=hr&team_id=147

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is asking for the team's aggregate numbers for a stat

i.e. How many home runs do the Yankees have
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is grouped by Team

i.e. Deeplink: mlbatbat://stats?stat_type=hitting&stat=hr&section=team

title: Utterance - Group By
custom_steps: When the user utters variables of the parameter for 'group by'
custom_expected: THEN the bot replies with the requested stat for each variable

custom_steps_separated.content:
- What team has the most hits?
- What organization has the most hits?
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the bot replies with the requested team stat

title: EDIT_Utterance - Game Type
custom_steps: When the user utters variables of the parameter for 'Game Type'
custom_expected: THEN the bot replies with the requested stat for each variable

custom_steps_separated.content:
- Who has the most hits in the regular season?
- Who has the most hits this season?
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the bot replies with the requested regular season stat

custom_steps_separated.content:
- Who has the most hits in the postseason?
- Who has the most hits in the playoffs?
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the bot replies with the requested postseason stat

custom_steps_separated.content:
- Who has the most hits in the wild card game?
- Who has the most hits in the wild card?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot replies with the requested F , AL, or NL stat

NOTE: 
At Bat does not support stats by individual matchup in the playoffs (i.e., ALDS Team A. vs. Team B). If the user provides a league, that can be included in the response and would cover all AL or NL teams that played in the round (i.e., 4 teams in the ALDS, 2 teams in the ALCS).

custom_steps_separated.content:
- Who has the most hits in the division series?
- Who has the most hits in the ds?
- Who has the most hits in the alds?
- Who has the most hits in the nlds?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot replies with the requested D , AL, or NL stat

NOTE: 
At Bat does not support stats by individual matchup in the playoffs (i.e., ALDS Team A. vs. Team B). If the user provides a league, that can be included in the response and would cover all AL or NL teams that played in the round (i.e., 4 teams in the ALDS, 2 teams in the ALCS).

custom_steps_separated.content:
- Who has the most hits in the championship series?
- Who has the most hits in the cs?
- Who has the most hits in the alcs?
- Who has the most hits in the nlcs?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot replies with the requested L , AL, or NL stat

NOTE:
At Bat does not support stats by individual matchup in the playoffs (i.e., ALDS Team A. vs. Team B). If the user provides a league, that can be included in the response and would cover all AL or NL teams that played in the round (i.e., 4 teams in the ALDS, 2 teams in the ALCS).

custom_steps_separated.content:
- Who has the most hits in the world series?
- Who has the most hits in the fall classic?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot replies with the requested world series stat

NOTE: No need to define AL or NL here. MLB (the default) is assumed.

title: EDIT_Utterance - Time Frame
custom_steps: When the user utters variables of the parameter for 'Time Frame'
custom_expected: THEN the bot replies with the requested stat for each variable

custom_steps_separated.content:
- Who has the most career RBIs?
- Who has the most all time RBIs?
- Who has the most all-time RBIs?
- Who has the most ever RBIs?
- Who has the most in history RBIs?
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the bot replies with the requested career stat

custom_steps_separated.content:
- Who has the most RBIs in a single season?
- Who has the most RBIs in a season?
- Who has the most RBIs in a year?
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the bot replies with the requested single season stat

custom_steps_separated.content:
- Who has the most RBI's this season?
- Who has the most RBI's this year?
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the bot replies with the requested current year stat

custom_steps_separated.content: - Who had the most RBIs in 2010?
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the bot replies with the requested year stat

title: Utterance - Organization
custom_steps: When the user utters variables of the parameter for 'Organization'
custom_expected: THEN the bot replies with the requested stat for each variable

custom_steps_separated.content:
- Who has the most home runs in baseball?
- Who has the most home runs in the league?
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the bot replies with the requested mlb stat

custom_steps_separated.content:
- Who has the most home runs in the AL?
- Who has the most home runs in the American?
- Who has the most home runs in the American League?
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the bot replies with the requested AL stat

custom_steps_separated.content:
- Who has the most home runs in the NL?
- Who has the most home runs in the National?
- Who has the most home runs in the National League?
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the bot replies with the requested NL stat

custom_steps_separated.content:
- Who has the most home runs on the Athletics?

NOTE: Test all team names and nick names; singular versions as well (i.e. Athletic)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the bot replies with the requested team/nick name stat

title: Follow Up Questions
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks follow up questions

i.e.
Who has the most hits?
What about batters?
custom_expected:
THEN the bot should respond accordingly with the correct follow up stats

i.e.
Who has the most hits? - mlbatbat://stats?stat_type=pitching&stat=h
What about batters? - mlbatbat://stats?stat_type=hitting&stat=h

title: Singular Version of Team Name
custom_preconds: Given the bot supports singular versions of team names so that users can ask questions about individual performances on specific teams
custom_steps:
WHEN the user requests a singular version of a team name

i.e. 
What Yankee has the most career home runs?
custom_expected: THEN the users can ask questions about individual performances on specific team

title: Keyword 'Against' used in a request
custom_steps: WHEN the user makes a requesting using the key word 'against'
custom_expected: THEN this is indicating the query is about fielding

title: Batting Stat Type Categories_SDBB-331
custom_steps: WHEN the user requests the following batting stats (test all the name variants for each stat)

custom_steps_separated.content:
Batting Average (AVG)
average
batting leader

i.e. Who leads the league in Batting Average?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the batting's batting average (AVG) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual Batting Average for the current year in the regular season in mlb

custom_steps_separated.content:
Home Runs (HR)
homers
dingers
bombs
long balls

i.e. 
- Who are the All Time Home Run Leaders?
- What team has the most home runs in the 2016 postseason
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the batting's home runs (HR) stat

i.e.
- The user is provided with the individual home runs for his career in the regular season in mlb
- The user is provided with the team's home runs for the requested year in the postseason in mlb

custom_steps_separated.content:
Runs Batted In (RBI)
ribbies
R B Is

i.e. 
- Who has the most Career RBIs in the NL?
- Who has the most RBIs
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the batting's runs batted in (RBI) stat

i.e.
- The user is provided with the individual runs batted in for his career in the regular season in the requested league
- The user is provided with the batter's runs batted in for the current year in the regular season

custom_steps_separated.content:
Stolen Bases (SB)
steals

i.e. What Athletic has the most Stolen Bases in a Single Season?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the batting's stolen bases (SB) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual stolen bases for the single season in the regular season for the requested team

custom_steps_separated.content:
Runs (R)

i.e. Who had the most Runs in 2016?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the batting's runs (R) stat

i.e. The user is provided with the individual runs for the requested year in the regular season in mlb

custom_steps_separated.content:
On-Base Percentage (OBP)
on-base
on-base %
NOTE: obp is not abbreviated

i.e. Who had the best On-Base Percentages of all time?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the batting's on-base percentage (OBP) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual on-base percentage for his career in the regular season in mlb

custom_steps_separated.content:
Slugging Percentage (SLG)
slugging

i.e. Who had the best Slugging Percentage in the 2016 World Series?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the batting's slugging percentage (SLG) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual slugging percentage in the requested year in the world series in mlb

custom_steps_separated.content:
On-Base + Slugging (OPS)
on base plus slugging
O P S

i.e. Who has the best Single Season OPS?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the batting's on-base + slugging (OPS) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual on-base + slugging in the single season in the regular season in mlb

custom_steps_separated.content:
Hits (H)
base hits

i.e. Who leads the league in Hits?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the batting's hits (H) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual hits in the current year in the regular season in mlb

custom_steps_separated.content:
Doubles (2B)

i.e. What team had the most doubles in the National League in 2015?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the batting's doubles (2B) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the team's doubles for the requested year in the regular season for the requested league

custom_steps_separated.content:
Triples (3B)

i.e. Who has the most career triples on the Athletics?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the batting's triples (3B) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual triples in his career in the regular season for the requested team

custom_steps_separated.content:
Walks (BB)
free bases
free passes

i.e. Who has the most walks in a single season?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the batting's walks (BB) stat

i.e. The user is provided with the individual walks in a single season in the regular season in mlb

custom_steps_separated.content:
Strikeouts (SO)
Ks

i.e. What batter has the most career strikeouts?

Note: Since default stat is Pitching, must use batter reference in query to obtain Batting Stat
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the batting's strikeouts (SO) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual strikeouts in his career in the regular season in mlb

custom_steps_separated.content:
Caught Stealing (CS)

i.e. Who has been caught stealing the most this season on the Red Sox?

NOTE: in Batting refers to batter
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the batting's caught stealing (CS) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual caught stealing in the current year in the regular season for the requested team

custom_steps_separated.content:
Games (G)

i.e. Who has played the most games this year on the Red Sox?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the batting's games (G) stat 

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual games in the current year in the regular season for the requested team

custom_steps_separated.content:
At Bats (AB)

i.e. Who had the most at bats in the AL in the 2016 postseason
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the batting's at bats (AB) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the team's at bat for the requested year in the postseason for the requested league

title: Pitching Stat Type Categories_SDBB-332
custom_steps: WHEN the user request the following pitching stats (test all the name variant for each stat)

custom_steps_separated.content:
Earned Run Average (ERA)
era

i.e. What team has the best ERA?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the pitching's earned run average (ERA) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the team's earned run average in the current year in the regular season in mlb

custom_steps_separated.content:
Wins (W)

i.e. 
- Who has the most Wins in 2010?
- Most wins a pitcher has received in a year?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the pitching's wins (W) stat

i.e. 
- The user will be provided with the individual win in the requested year in the regular season in mlb
- The user will be provided with the individual win in the single season in mlb

custom_steps_separated.content:
Strikeouts (SO)
Ks

i.e. Who has the most strikeouts?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the pitching's strikeouts (SO) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual strikeouts in the current year in the regular season in mlb

custom_steps_separated.content:
Saves (SV)

i.e. Who led the American League in Saves in the 2016 Division Series?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the pitching's saves (SV) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual saves in the current year in the division series in the requested league

custom_steps_separated.content:
Walks + Hits Per Inning Pitched (WHIP)
whip

i.e. What AL team had the best WHIP in the 2015 postseason?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the pitching's walks + hits per inning pitched (WHIP) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the team's walks + hits per inning pitched in the requested year in the postseason in the requested league

custom_steps_separated.content:
Batting Average Against (BAA)

i.e. Who has the best Batting Average Against?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the pitching's batting average against (BAA) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual batting average against in the current year in the regular season in mlb

custom_steps_separated.content:
Innings Pitched (IP)

i.e. Who threw the most innings last year?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the pitching's innings pitched (IP) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual innings pitched in the requested year in the regular season in mlb

custom_steps_separated.content:
Complete Games (CG)

i.e. Who had the most complete games last season?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the pitching's completed games (CG) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual completed games in the requested year in the regular season in mlb

custom_steps_separated.content:
Games (G)

i.e. Who has pitched the most games this season?

Note: Since default stat is Batting, must use pitcher reference in query to obtain Pitching Stat
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the pitching's games (G) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual games in the current year in the regular season in mlb

custom_steps_separated.content:
Games Started (GS)
starts

i.e. Who has started the most games this year?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the pitching's games started (GS) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual games stated in the current year in the regular season in mlb

custom_steps_separated.content:
Losses (L)

i.e. What pitcher has the most Losses in the AL?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the pitching's losses (L) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual losses in the current year in the regular season in the requested league

custom_steps_separated.content:
Save Opportunities (SVO)
save chances

i.e. Who had the most save opportunities in a single season?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the pitching's save opportunities (SVO) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual save opportunities in the single season in the regular season in mlb

custom_steps_separated.content:
Earned Runs (ER)

i.e. Who has the most earned runs?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the pitching's earned runs (ER) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual earned runs in the current year in the regular season in mlb

custom_steps_separated.content:
Runs (R)

i.e. 
- What pitcher has given up the most Runs
- Who has allowed the most Runs

Note: Since default stat is Batting, must use pitcher reference in query to obtain Pitching Stat
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the pitching's runs (R) stat

i.e. 
- The user will be provided with the individual's runs given up in the current year in the regular season in mlb
- The user will be provided with the individual's allowed runs in the current year in the regular season in mlb

custom_steps_separated.content:
Hits (H)

i.e. Which pitcher gave up the most hits this year?

*** NOTE: Must mention pitcher in query?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the pitching's hits (H) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual hits in the current year for the requested team

custom_steps_separated.content:
Home Runs (HR)
homers
dingers
bombs
long balls

i.e. What pitcher game up the most home runs in the NL in 2014?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the pitching's home run (HR) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the individual home runs in the requested year in the regular season in the requested league

Note: Since default stat is Batting, must use pitching reference in query to obtain Pitching Stat

custom_steps_separated.content:
Walks (BB)
free bases
free passes

i.e. What team's pitching staff leads the league in Walks?

Note: Since default stat is Batting, must use pitcher reference in query to obtain Pitching Stat
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be provided with the pitching's walks (BB) stat

i.e. The user will be provided with the team's walks in the current year in the regular postseason in mlb

title: Fielding Stat Type Categories_SDBB-333
